ovdesc.p: This is the parameter file that drives the Position Management System.
a. To allow the overnight batch process to determine either:
(i) To read the unauthorised contracts/deals for 'HOLD' or 'DELETE' process or
(ii) To read the authorised file and to re-create all the activities.
b. To set the appropriate Position Classes for various activities relating to the FOREX application. PM.POSN.REFERENCE can then be used to determine which position contains what 'POSN.CLASS'.

This field holds the name of the user exit routine that can be triggered to amend the values calculated by the CORE position management system for transactions from the FRA.DEAL application. This subroutine needs to have the following arguments
Incoming Arguments :
DEAL.DETAILS - Dimensioned array , which holds the contract details.
Outgoing Arguments :
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS
PROCESSED - A flag to indicate whether the user exit routine has generated the position classes.
RESERVED.1 - to be passed as Null
RESERVED.2 - to be passed as Null
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS needs to be a a Dynamic Array which holds the following information.
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.ASST.LIAB.CD> - Asset / Liability
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.POSN.CLASS> - Position Class
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.CCY.AMT> - Amount
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.RATE> - Reference Rate / Settlement Rate
PM.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.VALUE.DATE> - Start date / Maturity Date
Where,
X – is the iterator for the number of position classes.
PM.MA.ASST.LIAB.CD, PM.MA.POSN.CLASS, PM.MA.CCY.AMT, PM.MA.RATE, PM.MA.VALUE.DATE – are the positions as defined in I_PM.MAT.ACTIVITY.
User exit routine is designed to perform the following operation.

For FRA HEDGE purchase deal the position classes FRXDS, FRXDM should hold the reference price instead of the FRA Contract price. For a FRA HEDGE Sale Contract , the position classes FRXLS, FRXLM should hold the reference price instead of the FRA contract price.

The formed Position Classes and its details are returned to the calling routine. The calling routine modifies the built position classes with the values returned from the user exit routine or appends the newly built position classes and the position management files PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY , PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS are built accordingly.
The field holds the name of the user exit routine. The routine name should be available in EB.API application.

This field holds the name of the user exit routine that can be triggered to amend the values calculated by the CORE position management system for transactions from the Forex application. This subroutine needs to have the following arguments
Incoming parameters - PRINCIPAL.CCY - used to denote the principal currency.
Outgoing Parameters - PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS
RESERVED.1 - to be passed as Null
RESERVED.2 - to be passed as Null
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS needs to be a dynamic array holding the following structure
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.ASST.LIAB.CD> - Asset / Liability
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.POSN.CLASS> - Position Class
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.CCY.AMT> - Notional Amount
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.RATE> - Interest Rate
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.VALUE.DATE> - Value date
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.POSN.TYPE> - Position Type
PM.FX.USR.POSN.CLASS<x, PM.MA.CURRENCY> - Currency.
X – is the iterator for the number of position classes.
PM.MA.ASST.LIAB.CD, PM.MA.POSN.CLASS, PM.MA.CCY.AMT, PM.MA.RATE, PM.MA.VALUE.DATE, PM.MA.POSN.TYPE, PM.MA.CURRENCY – are the positions as defined in I_PM.MAT.ACTIVITY.

The details such as rate, amount that is updated in the position classes FX:’RevalType’:S or FX:’RevalType’:M in PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY / PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS can be modified as per the requirement of the bank.

For e.g., The bank identifies one of the currencies in the transaction as the PRINCIPAL.CCY. The definition of PRINCIPAL.CCY is, if the deal involves local currency then local currency is the PRINCIPAL.CCY and for a cross currency deal, buy currency is the PRINCIPAL.CCY . The core functionality is to default the interest rate from the Periodic Interest table for the base currency and to derive the interest rate for the Non Base currency. This can be modified in the user exit routine, as to default the Interest rate from the Periodic Interest table for the Secondary currency and based on the interest rate for the secondary currency, the interest rate for the Principal Currency can be derived. So, user exit routine builds position classes with the above details.

The formed Position Classes and its details are returned to the calling routine. The calling routine modifies the built position classes with the values returned from the user exit routine or appends the newly built position classes and the position management files PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY , PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS are built accordingly.
The field holds the name of the user exit routine. The routine name should be available in EB.API application.

Specifies whether contracts with Zero interest rates need to be updated in PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS GAP position records in the Sub-value 10 fields.

If this field is Null or NO, then contracts with Zero interest rates would not be updated in PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS GAP position records in the Sub-value 10 fields, and consequently they would not be reported in PM.GAP enquiry, which is the functionality before the T24 release G14.1.

On the other hand, if this field is set to YES, then then contracts with Zero interest rates would be updated in PM.DLY.POSN.CLASS GAP position records in the Sub-value 10 fields, and consequently they would be reported in PM.GAP enquiry.
Example 1: PM.PARAMETER: ZERO.INT.RATE:YES
MM0235700101: PRINCIPAL: USD 1,000,000, INTEREST.RATE: 0, MATURITY DATE: 20031223
MM0235700102: PRINCIPAL: USD 2,000,000, INTEREST.RATE: 10, MATURITY DATE: 20031223
BNK
Example 2: PM.PARAMETER: ZERO.INT.RATE:NO or NULL.
MM0235700301: PRINCIPAL: EUR 1,000,000, INTEREST.RATE: 0, MATURITY DATE: 20031223
MM0235700302: PRINCIPAL: EUR 2,000,000, INTEREST.RATE: 10, MATURITY DATE: 20031223
BNK
Valid values are YES, NO or Null.

This is the processing code for the application defined in previous field.
For applications not linked to PM through generic interface
1. NAU if set means that only the following PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY records will be regenerated in the COB
those with a value date falling within the COB processing period
those where the TRAN.PROC.DTL date falls within the COB processing period
2. CA means that all PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY records will be regenerated.
FX records will always be re generated as the local equivalents need to be revalued.
The reason for the above is to try and improve performance in a T24 non stop environment.

NAU setting should be quicker as not as many records will be regenerated. An example would be PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY records with a large number of weekly or monthly schedules. If NAU is set then these types of records would only be processed when a value date is due. The disadvantage is that account (CAS) type activities would not be recalcualted on a daily basis so if an acount balance changes the interest key would only be recalculated on the next due date. The setting basically depends on the type of enquiries being used.
3. For interface using generic PM the parameters defined in the application
PM.APPL.SELECTION
would further determine the maintenance of
PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY
records during batch processing

Specifies whether a FXP Position needs to be generated in PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY for the Local Currency, when a transaction involving a Foreign Currency and a Local Currency is input in the Applications FT, TT and DC.

If this parameter is set to YES, data related to FXP Position class FTFFT or TTFXP (depending on the Parameterization in PM.PC.PARAM) would be respectively updated in PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY, for Local Currency movement also, when a Transaction involving a Foreign and Local Currency is input in the Applications FT and TT.

If this parameter is set to YES, data related to FXP Position class DCFDC (depending on the Parameterization in PM.PC.PARAM) would be updated in PM.TRAN.ACTIVITY for Local Currency movement also, when a Foreign Currency Transaction
is input in the Application DC.
In this parameter is set to NO or Null, then in the above specified cases the FXP type Position class data would be generated only for Foreign Currency movement.
Valid values are YES, NO or Null.
NO and Null are equivalent.
For internal use only.
2 Numeric Characters. Value = 22
